thread.title: ‘Squad’ Democrats only votes against Bill to ban Hamas terrorists from entering the U.S.
thread.title_full: ‘Squad’ Democrats only votes against Bill to ban Hamas terrorists from entering the U.S.

author: Sara Carter Staff
title: ‘Squad’ Democrats only votes against Bill to ban Hamas terrorists from entering the U.S.
text:
Israel
‘Squad’ Democrats only votes against Bill to ban Hamas terrorists from entering the U.S.
There can be no explanation other than complete anti-American and anti-Israel liberalism behind two infamous ‘Squad’ members of congress voting to allow terrorists into the United States.
The “
No Immigration Benefits for Hamas Terrorists Act” thankfully passed the House by a 422-2-1 vote. According to C-SPAN the only two legislators to vote against the legislation, were Democratic Representatives Cori Bush or Missouri and Rashida Tlaib of Michigan.
The bill will ban members of Hamas and Palestinian Islamic Jihad involved in the October 7 attacks against Israel from entering the United States, reports the
Daily Caller News Foundation.
The bill was introduced by Republican California Representative Tom McClintock, which would mandate that “any alien who carried out, participated in, planned, financed, afforded material support to, or otherwise facilitated any of the attacks against Israel initiated by Hamas beginning on October 7, 2023, is inadmissible” to the U.S., according to its text.
Democratic Representative Della Ramirez of Illinois was the only lawmaker to vote “present,” according to C-SPAN.
Palestinian terrorists murdered approximately
1,200 people on Oct. 7, 2023, raped numerous women and took hundreds of hostages back to the Gaza Strip. Nonetheless, the horrors have not stopped Bush and Tlaib from their public anti-Israel rhetoric.
The
Daily Caller News Foundation identifies examples of the hateful representatives:
Bush, meanwhile, has
asserted that the Israeli military is perpetrating “ethnic cleansing” against Palestinians and has called for the U.S. to stop funding Israel.
Tlaib, whose House colleagues voted to censure her for her anti-Israel rhetoric, and Bush, who is under
federal investigation for alleged misuse of federal security money, have both calledIsrael an “apartheid state.”
Both lawmakers have also
suggested that Israel could be committing genocide in its military response to the terrorist groups operating in the Gaza Strip, and they have both repeatedly called for a ceasefire since Israel’s ground invasion of the territory commenced.
Tlaib has defended the use of the Palestinian rallying cry, “from the river to the sea, Palestine will be free,” which critics posit is a slogan that explicitly calls for the erasure of Israel and its people. She
considers the saying to be “an aspirational call for freedom, human rights, and peaceful coexistence, not death, destruction, or hate.”

Israel
VIDEO: Israeli commandos go undercover to take out terror cell in West Bank hospital
Incredible video has surfaced of the impossible lengths Israeli forces go through in order to defeat terror. On Tuesday, Israeli commandos entered a West Bank hospital disguised as nurses and other civilians to take out three terrorists, one of whom the military said was planning an “imminent attack”.
Video
showed the soldiers dressed as medical personnel, women wearing hijabs, and a man holding a baby carrier as they moved through the Ibn Sina hospital. They killed Mohammed Jalamna, whom the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said in a press release was a Hamas terrorist sending weapons to other operatives and planning an attack inspired by Oct. 7. The IDF accused him of using the hospital as a hideout.
The commandos also killed brothers Mohammed and Basel Ghazawi, who were involved in the activities of the Palestinian Islamic Jihad terror group. Hamas confirmed that Jalamna was a member of its Qassam Brigades, the terror group’s military wing, while Palestinian Islamic Jihad said the Ghazawi brothers belonged to its own armed Jenin Brigades, Reuters
reported.
Dr. Naji Nazzal, the hospital’s director, told the outlet that Basel Ghazawi was receiving treatment for a spinal injury he sustained in October, which paralyzed him.
